**Required Output Format**:
```

Hypothesis_4: [Additional hypothesis covering different aspects]
```

**Analysis & Hypothesis Formation Guidelines**:
- Analyze the REAL activation values and key tokens from the exemplars
- Look for linguistic patterns (suffixes, prefixes, word types)
- Identify semantic patterns (topics, domains, concepts)
- Note structural patterns (syntax, formatting)
- Be specific: "English -tion suffixes" not "English words"
- Focus on COMMON patterns across multiple exemplars
- Consider which specific tokens have the highest activation values
- **MANDATORY**: After observations, form specific, testable hypotheses about what the feature detects
- Be precise: "This feature detects Python import statements" not "This feature detects programming"
- Each hypothesis must be testable with model.run
- Include at least one negative control hypothesis

**Format Requirements**:
- Always start each hypothesis with "Hypothesis_X: [your specific hypothesis]"
- Base hypotheses directly on observations, not assumptions
- Include positive and negative cases
- Cover different aspects of the feature (linguistic, semantic, structural)

**Rules**:
- Observe activation patterns, activation values and identify high-activating examples
- Do NOT issue [TOOL] commands
- Base analysis on the REAL exemplar data provided above
- Be scientific and evidence-based
- Focus on what the feature actually detects based on the activation patterns

OBSERVATION:
- Pattern 1: Activation is sharply localized on the token ‚Äú tab‚Äù (and ‚Äú tabs‚Äù), with all surrounding tokens at 0.000. Examples:
  - ‚Äú... window or tab ...‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äò tab‚Äô: 14.500 (highest)
  - ‚Äú... one tab bar ...‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äò tab‚Äô: 12.812
  - ‚ÄúSwitching tab ...‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äò tab‚Äô: 12.500
  - ‚Äú... different tab or window ...‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äò tab‚Äô: 12.250
  - ‚Äú... the tabs in ...‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äò tabs‚Äô: 11.938
- Pattern 2: The feature also fires when ‚Äútab‚Äù is a subword at token boundaries, e.g., ‚Äútablix‚Äù tokenized as ‚Äò tab‚Äô: 11.562 followed by ‚Äòlix‚Äô: 0.000.
- Pattern 3: The highest activations correspond to the standalone token ‚Äú tab‚Äù in UI/navigation contexts (‚Äútab bar‚Äù, ‚Äútab or window‚Äù, ‚Äúbrowser tabs‚Äù), but only the ‚Äú tab/ tabs‚Äù token itself carries activation; nearby UI words (‚Äúwindow‚Äù, ‚Äúbar‚Äù, ‚Äúbrowsers‚Äù) remain at 0.000.
- Common elements: lower-case ‚Äò tab‚Äô or ‚Äò tabs‚Äô tokens; UI/navigation contexts (browser/app tabs, tab bar, switching tabs); activation strictly tied to the ‚Äò tab/ tabs‚Äô token; plural ‚Äò tabs‚Äô and subword prefix cases show strong but slightly lower activations than singular ‚Äò tab‚Äô.

[HYPOTHESIS LIST]:
Hypothesis_1: The feature is a lexical detector for the BPE tokens ‚Äú tab‚Äù and ‚Äú tabs‚Äù, with strongest activation on the standalone lower-case ‚Äò tab‚Äô (~14‚Äì15), slightly lower on ‚Äò tabs‚Äô (~11‚Äì12), and still positive when ‚Äò tab‚Äô appears as a subword prefix (e.g., ‚Äú tab‚Äù + ‚Äúlix‚Äù in ‚Äútablix‚Äù, ~11‚Äì12).

Hypothesis_2: The feature primarily encodes the UI/navigation concept of tabs (e.g., ‚Äútab bar‚Äù, ‚Äúbrowser tab‚Äù), but its activation is largely context-independent and driven by the presence of the ‚Äò tab/ tabs‚Äô token; therefore sentences like ‚ÄúPress the tab key‚Äù or ‚Äúopen a new tab‚Äù will also strongly activate via ‚Äò tab‚Äô.

Hypothesis_3: Negative control ‚Äî Words that begin with ‚Äútab‚Äù but are tokenized without a separate ‚Äò tab‚Äô subtoken (e.g., ‚Äútable‚Äù, ‚Äútablet‚Äù) will show low/near-zero activation; in contrast, words that split into ‚Äò tab‚Äô + suffix (e.g., ‚Äútablix‚Äù, ‚Äútabular‚Äù if tokenized as ‚Äò tab‚Äô + ‚Äòular‚Äô) will activate on the ‚Äò tab‚Äô subtoken while the suffix remains near zero.

Hypothesis_4: Case/form sensitivity ‚Äî The feature is tuned to the lower-case token form ‚Äò tab/ tabs‚Äô. Capitalized ‚ÄúTab‚Äù or all-caps ‚ÄúTAB‚Äù (if mapped to different tokens like ‚Äò Tab‚Äô or ‚Äò TAB‚Äô) will yield reduced activation compared to lower-case ‚Äò tab‚Äô, whereas hyphenated or concatenated forms that still produce a ‚Äò tab‚Äô subtoken (e.g., ‚Äútab-bar‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äò tab‚Äô, ‚Äò-‚Äô, ‚Äòbar‚Äô) will activate on the ‚Äò tab‚Äô piece.

[DESIGNING TEST FOR HYPOTHESIS 1 ONLY]
